description: Police in Washington state were called when a local Goodwill store reported a cooler someone had donated was filled with marijuana. The cooler contained 3.75 pounds of pot worth about $24,000.
title: 5 bags of pot found inside cooler donated to Goodwill
title_page: 5 bags of pot found inside cooler donated to Goodwill | Daily Mail Online
text:
A cooler donated to Goodwill in Monroe, Washington contained five bags of marijuana
Five large bags of marijuana were found in a cooler donated to Goodwill.
The pot was discovered in a donation made at a store in Monroe, Washington at the start of this week.
Although it is legal in Washington for people over 21 to possess one ounce of weed, this particular stash was more than 60 times over the limit.
When staff at the store discovered the marijuana which was worth about $24,000, the police were called.
'We went over there and they opened the lid and in there was five large bags of marijuana,' Debbie Willis of the Monroe Police Department said. 'Normally when we go there, it is for a shoplifter, but not anything like this.'
Police are now trying to track down the owner of the cooler by looking through CCTV footage but staff are not sure at which location the cooler was donated.
Goodwill say that is it common to receive strange donations such as forgotten money left in the pockets of clothes, but not 60 ounces of marijuana.
'This is a reminder to check your purse, pockets, or cooler to make sure you're donating the items you mean to,' Katherine Boury, a spokesperson for Goodwill said to CNN.
The bags contained 60 ounces of weed. Police are now looking through CCTV footage to see who it was that dropped off the cooler along with the stash of hash
Ms. Boury said that she has encountered even stranger donations during her time with the charity.
'In 2013, three human skulls were found,' she said. 'Two had been used for medical research, and one Native American skull was more than 100 years old.
'We worked with authorities to track down the origin of the Native American skull for proper burial.'
As for the marijuana, Goodwill say that all of it will be burned in the coming weeks.
